item.title: NFL Hall of Famer Terrell Davis says he was handcuffed and removed from United flight
item.description: The former NFL player says the “traumatizing experience” took place when the plane landed on Saturday. He says six FBI and other law enforcement agents boarded the plane and placed him in handcuffs.

item.title: Democrats plan a roll call vote for Biden this month. But some want to wait
item.description: In May, Democrats decided to hold their roll call vote for their nominee well before the party’s convention. But now, some in the party say they want to put the brakes on that plan.

item.title: Central Valley, where 1/4 of U.S.'s food is grown, faces extreme heat for a 2nd week
item.description: The central valley of California produces a quarter of the nation's food. How are farmworkers dealing with an intense, long-lasting heatwave sweeping the interior of the state?

item.title: Where J.D. Vance stands on key issues
item.description: Sen. J.D. Vance, R-Ohio, who once called former Donald Trump “America’s Hitler” but is now one of his most vocal supporters in Congress, has been named Trump’s 2024 vice presidential pick. Here's where he stands on key issues.

item.title: NSC warned Secret Service about an increased Iranian threat to Trump
item.description: There are no identified ties between the shooter, Thomas Matthew Crooks, and any foreign or domestic accomplices or co-conspirators. But Iranian threats against Trump officials date back to the killing of Qassem Soleimani.

item.title: Reality star Savannah Chrisley will speak tonight, likely about her incarcerated parents
item.description: One of tonight's scheduled speakers is Savannah Chrisley. Her parents, Todd and Julie, were accused of funding their lavish lifestyle through dishonest means, and in June 2022 were found guilty on federal charges including bank fraud and tax evasion.
